description: Bio-technical support is required year round and duties vary by season and geographic area...
full_summary:
# Biological and Technical Support Services for Comox Valley Sector
## Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada is issuing a tender for bio-technical support services for the Comox Valley sector. The incumbent will work with the Community Advisor(s) to provide technical support for various fisheries and habitat restoration projects.

## Scope of Work

The scope of work includes:

* Fish production: broodstock collection, spawning, incubation, hatchery rearing of juvenile salmon, and fish culture support
* Habitat restoration and enhancement: fry salvage, riparian planting and management, water quality monitoring, habitat surveys and mapping
* Salmon stock assessment: juvenile salmon counting programs, hydraulic sampling, and adult escapement assessment
* Education and awareness: classroom sessions, educational field trips, developing educational programs
* Administration: project development, project funding applications, report writing

## Service Requirements

The Contractor is expected to work year-round and provide bio-technical services on a project-specific basis. Work priorities may change quickly due to weather, fish availability, and other factors beyond the control of the Community Advisor.

## Submission and Evaluation Criteria

Not specified.

## Request for Proposal (RFP)

A RFP has been published, which includes detailed information on the tender and the submission process. The RFP can be downloaded from the Canada Buys website.

## Contact Information

* Name: Kimberly Martin
* Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
* Phone: 506-429-2397
* Address: 301 Bishop Dr, Fredericton, NB E3C 2M6

## Submission Deadline

The tender closing date is November 23, 2022, at 13:00 EST.
